alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 3:21AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding remains possible, caused by snowmelt and recent rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas of streams with limited impacts on roadways at this time. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 AM EDT, stream and river levels remain high due to runoff from recent rains the melting of the last of the remnant snow pack. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Presque Isle, Caribou, Houlton, Fort Fairfield, Limestone, Van Buren, Mapleton, Washburn, Mars Hill, Hodgdon, Easton, Woodland, Island Falls, Bridgewater, Smyrna, Amity, Haynesville, Scopan, Dudley Township and Smyrna Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
